movies.title: 9 Souls
movies.plot: Nine convicts escape from prison; most are convicted murders. They commandeer a van from a strip club. Their plan is to find a stash of counterfeit money that a deranged cell mate told them about, divide it, then part ways. They make it to the site where the money is supposed to be hidden, and then one by one, each seeks out the place he wants to be, a version of home, somewhere to connect. Will it end well for any of them?
movies.simplePlot: Nine convicts escape from prison; most are convicted murders. They commandeer a van from a strip club. Their plan is to find a stash of counterfeit money that a deranged cell mate told them...

biography.bio: Yoshio Harada was born on February 29, 1940 in Tokyo, Japan. He was an actor and producer, known for Zigeunerweisen (1980), Rônin-gai (1990) and Still Walking (2008). He died on July 19, 2011 in Tokyo.
biography.name: Yoshio Harada

biography.bio: The uniquely beautiful and talented Ryuhei Matsuda was born May 9, 1983, in the Tokyo Metropolis, to famous actors Miyuki Matsuda (née Kumagai) and Yûsaku Matsuda. Six years later, Ryuhei's life took a tragic turn when his father, at the age of 40, died from bladder cancer. Ryuhei and his mother persevered, and unlike most offspring of famous actors, he didn't give much thought to acting as a child. Nine years later, at the age of 15, that would all change when Ryuhei was approached by Nagisa Oshima with a life changing offer: to take on the prominent role as the androgynous youth, Samurai Sozaburo Kano in the controversial Gohatto. Ryuhei took the role head on, preparing himself emotionally and physically by practicing ken do for two months straight. His film debut was a success, and acted on par with the likes of Takeshi Kitano and Tadanobu Asano. For his hard work, Ryuhei was rewarded with critical acclaim and numerous awards. Shortly thereafter, he dropped out of high school to fully devote his time and efforts on his burgeoning film career, and with much success. Lightning would strike again for Ryuhei in 2001, in the dark, thought provoking high school drama, Blue Spring, directed by Toshiaki Toyoda. Such as with his debut, Ryuhei received yet more acclaim and this time, more widespread recognition for his role as the laid back, brutal, yet introspective high school gang leader, Kujo. The film roles kept coming, such as the 2003 reunion with writer director Toshiaki Toyoda in the acclaimed film 9 Souls, and a bit part in the flashy, comedic anime-to-film live action adaptation of Cutie Honey in the following year. Ryuhei's trend of working with some of Japan's most talented actors and directors continued in 2004 and in 2005 in the violent Takashi Miike action film, Izo, co-starring Takeshi Kitano and the up-coming Ranpo jigoku, co-starring Tadanobu Asano. With his charisma, talent, and ability to take on roles varying from the comedic, outrageous, moving, and controversial, the sky's the limit for this young man.
biography.name: Ryûhei Matsuda

biography.bio: Genta Dairaku is an actor, known for The Whispering of the Gods (2005), Why Don't You Play in Hell? (2013) and Blue Spring (2001).
biography.name: Genta Dairaku

biography.bio: Eita was born on December 13, 1982 as Eita Nagayama. He is an actor, known for Memories of Matsuko (2006), Dear Doctor (2009) and Azumi (2003). He has been married to Kaela Kimura since September 1, 2010. They have one child.
biography.name: Eita

biography.bio: Yû Fujiki was born on March 2, 1931 in Tokyo, Japan as Yuuzou Suzuki. He was an actor, known for The Hidden Fortress (1958), Throne of Blood (1957) and King Kong vs. Godzilla (1962). He died on December 19, 2005 in Chûô-ku, Tokyo.
biography.name: Yû Fujiki

biography.bio: Asami Imajuku was born on January 7, 1978 in Miyazaki, Japan. She is an actress, known for Love My Life (2006), Blue (2002) and Tomie: Beginning (2005).
biography.name: Asami Imajuku

biography.bio: Jun Inoue is known for his work on Welcome Back, Mr. McDonald (1997), Megane wo kakete mask wo suruto itsumo kumoru (2012) and Nishi no petenshi Higashi no sagishi (1971). He was previously married to Emi Aoki.
biography.name: Jun Inoue

biography.bio: Itsuji Itao was born on July 18, 1963 in Osaka, Japan. He is known for his work on Tokyo Gore Police (2008), Air Doll (2009) and Why Don't You Play in Hell? (2013).
biography.name: Itsuji Itao

biography.bio: Misaki Itô was born on May 26, 1977 in Iwaki, Fukushima, Japan as Tomoko Anzai. She is an actress, known for Ju-on: The Grudge (2002), Sea Cat (2004) and James Bond 007: Everything or Nothing (2003).
biography.name: Misaki Itô

biography.bio: Chihara Junia was born on March 30, 1974 in Kyoto, Japan as Koji Chihara. He is an actor, known for Odaiba seikeijuku (2012), Chihara Jr. no eiga seisaku iinkai (2009) and Kume pipo: Zettai aitai 1001 nin (2009).
biography.name: Chihara Junia

biography.bio: Kazuki Kitamura was born on July 17, 1969 in Osaka, Japan as Yasushi Kitamura. He is an actor, known for Kill Bill: Vol. 2 (2004), Kill Bill: Vol. 1 (2003) and The Raid 2 (2014).
biography.name: Kazuki Kitamura

biography.bio: Jun Kunimura was born on November 16, 1955 in Kumamoto, Japan. He is an actor, known for Kill Bill: Vol. 2 (2004), Kill Bill: Vol. 1 (2003) and Audition (1999).
biography.name: Jun Kunimura

biography.bio: Kotomi Kyôno was born on October 18, 1978 in Hiroshima, Japan. She is an actress, known for Shomuni (1998), Takeshis' (2005) and Le labyrinthe des rêves (1997).
biography.name: Kotomi Kyôno

biography.bio: Akaji Maro was born in 1943 in Ishikawa, Japan. He is known for his work on Kill Bill: Vol. 2 (2004), Kill Bill: Vol. 1 (2003) and Kikujiro (1999).
biography.name: Akaji Maro

biography.bio: Takako Matsu was born on June 10, 1977 in Tokyo, Japan as Takako Fujima. She is an actress, known for Confessions (2010), La servante et le samouraï (2004) and Frozen (2013). She has been married to Yoshiyuki Sahashi since December 28, 2007.
biography.name: Takako Matsu
